features.name: Rage
features.desc: Using a bonus action, you can enter Rage. Rage is a primal power that makes you powerful

feature_data.name: Damage Resistance
feature_data.desc: You're resistant to the following damage types: Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing

feature_data.name: Rage Damage
feature_data.desc: When dealing damage with a Strength attack (using a weapon or an unarmed strike) you deal extra damage equal to the 'Rage Damage' property of your character's level

feature_data.name: Strength
feature_data.desc: You can roll with advantage on Strength checks and saving throws

feature_data.name: Damage Resistance
feature_data.desc: You're resistant to the following damage types: Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing

feature_data.name: Concentration
feature_data.desc: You're unable to concentrate or cast spells.

feature_data.name: Duration
feature_data.desc: Rage stays active until the end of your next turn or until you get incapacitated. you can extend your rage period by: making an attack roll against an enemy, forcing the enemy to make a saving throw or by taking a bonus action to extend the rage period

features.name: Unarmored Defense
features.desc: While Unarmored, your base AC is 10 + DEX modifier + CON modifier

features.name: Weapon Mastery
features.desc: You are proficient with 2 weapon types of your choice. This grants you mastery properties of those weapons. Once per long rest you can train to change your chosen weapons.

features.name: Danger Sense
features.desc: you get an uncomfortable feeling when you think things arent right. When dodging things you can roll with advantage on DEX saving throws, unless you're incapacitated

features.name: Reckless Attack
features.desc: Don't think about defense for a bit and just attack. This gives you advantage on attack rolls, but also grants advantage for your enemies

features.name: Brutal Strike
features.desc: If you use Reckless Attack, you can forgo any Advantage on one Strength-based attack roll of your choice on your turn. The chosen attack roll mustn't have Disadvantage. If the chosen attack roll hits, the target takes an extra 1d10 damage of the same type dealt by the weapon or Unarmed Strike, and you can cause one Brutal Strike effect of your choice. You have the following effect options.

feature_data.name: Forceful Blow
feature_data.desc: The target is pushed 15 feet straight away from you. You can then move up to half your Speed straight toward the target without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

feature_data.name: Hamstring Blow
feature_data.desc: The target's Speed is reduced by 15 feet until the start of your next turn. A target can be affected by only one Hamstring Blow at a timeâ€”the most recent one.
